group_1.textRight: The Chuo library is impressive.
Not only does it have a study room, it also has@an area where one can use a computer.

group_1.textLeft: And they also recently added free Wi-Fi,@which must be convenient for some!

group_1.textRight: Wow. So these are basic services usable by@library patrons?

group_1.textLeft: It seems that resources are divided according@to the purpose of use.
We're all clear today.

group_1.textRight: Alright, I will inquire about the Tanabata story.

group_1.textLeft: We'll go dig into some statistics.

group_1.textRight: Yes, please take care of that.
｜I will accompany Nemu.｜
I've compiled statistics involving population,@incidents, and accidents on my end.
You're the genius. What do these results@indicate?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm… While the statistics themselves@aren't clear,
the ratio of Magical Girls in the population may@be higher in Futatsugi than Kamihama.
Still, I think it's a severe deviation.
I'm also curious about the incidents and@accidents involving Magical Girls in Kamihama.
Sakurako's right. Rumors are considered nothing@more than urban legends,
and despite the deaths and disappearances@during the clash between the East and the West,
it doesn't look like it caused any uproar...

group_1.textRight: So in short, the fact that incidents and accidents@involving Magical Girls haven't become well known
extends beyond Futatsugi, and applies to@Kamihama as well?

group_1.textLeft: So it would seem.

group_1.textRight: ...Even broaching the possibility of governmental@intrigue makes it all sounds like an urban legend.

group_1.textLeft: Au contraire, Kanagi.

group_1.textRight: Hm?

group_1.textLeft: This is way bigger than some urban legend.
This state of affairs is so mysterious and@unnatural as to merit the term "Fantasy."

group_1.textRight: I don't follow.

group_1.textLeft: It's similar to what happens in the human body.
When there's a problem, you want all of the@impacted organs to alert you,
but the liver is considered a silent organ.@It doesn't let you know if it's got an issue.

group_1.textRight: ...In other words, unusual situations involving@Magical Girls are ignored,
and considered to be just the way things are?

group_1.textLeft: That's just a hypothesis, though.

group_1.textRight: ｜We're back.｜
Thank you for waiting. I got wound up in my@inquiry.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah? How'd it go?

group_1.textRight: The names of the two Kamihama girls that have@survived history are Tsuyu Mizuna and Chizuru.
As we had assumed, the former is the very same@role Yachiyo had performed.
Here in Kamihama, Tanabata is associated with the@image of those two girls taking each other's hands.
That legend remains with us to this day.

group_1.textLeft: From what I know, it was a story about liberating@the people suffering from oppression.

group_1.textRight: That is indeed the case.

group_1.textLeft: Does it share any links to things like the@Tokime Clan's use of the term "Diviners?"

group_1.textRight: There were many questions I wanted to ask, but I@had too many reference materials to comb through.
I couldn't get to building hypotheses or opinions@that might have emerged from them.

group_1.textLeft: That makes zero sense.

group_1.textRight: I will therefore be reaching out to others,
for I know a Magical Girl well-versed in history.

group_1.textLeft: Shall we go see her ASAP?

group_1.textRight: She isn't involved with the Union, so it's best@we don't meet in person.

group_1.textLeft: You're right. Circumstances being what they are,@we wouldn't want them caught up in this...
Then we'll attend to the Satomi Medical Center@next.
I want to wrap up everything so we return@to Crescent House before nightfall.
Additionally, I would like Sakurako to go check@on Miyako.

group_1.textRight: ｜I refuse to leave Touka and Nemu's side.｜

group_1.textLeft: It's fine. I would be gratified if you could have@her join us.
Yeah, and we've got Kanagi with us in the@meantime, so we'll be fine.

group_1.textRight: ｜...Very well.｜
Now that you mention it, I wonder what your@father wanted to speak with us about.

group_1.textLeft: I have no idea, actually.
